QuestionJSON.Question: Jaime is working on an inventory management system for a local store. They want to add a feature to their program that was inspired by an open-source project they saw online. What steps should Jaime take next to observe intellectual property rights and give appropriate attribution?
QuestionJSON.Answer1: Jaime should cite the original source in the documentation, comments or program metadata.
QuestionJSON.Answer2: Jaime should replace the code with their own completely different solution to avoid copyright issues.
QuestionJSON.Answer3: Jaime should keep the code as is, no attribution is necessary since the code was written by them.
QuestionJSON.Answer4: Jaime should simply add the logo of the open-source project to his program’s user interface.
QuestionJSON.Explanation: Simply rewriting code does not negate the need for attribution. Jaime should include clear citations in the documentation, comments, or program metadata, and should adhere to any licensing requirements of the open-source project.
